topic: Metacognition & Self‑Regulated Learning: Studying Smarter by Monitoring Your Mind
target_audience: students and educators teaching study skills

refs.content: Learners often misjudge learning from fluency; recommends strategies like spacing, retrieval, interleaving, errorful learning.
Evidence-based teaching guide for fostering metacognition via planning/monitoring/evaluating and social metacognition.
Students' habits guided by deadlines rather than optimal strategies; need to teach cue-based scheduling and monitoring.

special_instructions: Include self-diagnostic checklist; show how to convert passive review into metacognitively rich retrieval-based cycles.
